summary: You delivered a well-structured 3-minute practice session with clear pacing. Your main opportunity is reducing filler words, which appeared 4.2 times per minute—mostly during transitions between your main points.

strengths.observation: Your 165 WPM speaking rate is within the optimal range, making you easy to follow without feeling rushed
Your articulation was crisp with well-placed pauses, scoring 82 in clarity

focus_area.observation: You used filler words 4.2 times per minute, primarily 'um' when transitioning between ideas at 12.5s and 89.2s
focus_area.impact: Replacing fillers with brief pauses will make you sound more confident and polished

recommended_drills.reason: Your filler patterns suggest you're using 'um' to hold the floor—this drill trains you to embrace silence instead
You already use power pauses effectively (3 detected)—building on this strength will naturally reduce fillers

next_session_goal: Reduce filler words from 4.2 to under 3 per minute while maintaining your current pace
